description: The Content-Encoding header indicates the encoding format of the HTTP message body. It is used to compress data and improve the efficiency of data transfer over the network.

response-directives.description: Specifies that the HTTP message body is compressed using the GZIP algorithm.
response-directives.details: The GZIP algorithm is a popular method of compressing data to reduce its size for more efficient data transfer. When the Content-Encoding header specifies the 'gzip' directive, the server has compressed the message body using the GZIP algorithm.

response-directives.description: Specifies that the HTTP message body is compressed using the DEFLATE algorithm.
response-directives.details: The DEFLATE algorithm is another method of compressing data to reduce its size for more efficient data transfer. When the Content-Encoding header specifies the 'deflate' directive, the server has compressed the message body using the DEFLATE algorithm.

response-directives.description: Specifies that the HTTP message body is compressed using the Brotli algorithm.
response-directives.details: The Brotli algorithm is a newer compression algorithm that is designed to be more efficient than GZIP and DEFLATE. When the Content-Encoding header specifies the 'br' directive, the server has compressed the message body using the Brotli algorithm.
